content.question: Alma is estimating the proportion of students in her school district who, in the past month, read at least 1 book. From a random sample of 50 students, she found that 32 students read at least 1 book last month. Assuming all conditions for inference are met, which of the following defines a 90 percent confidence interval for the proportion of all students in her district who read at least 1 book last month?

choices.label: <math alttext="32 plus or minus 1.645 times, the square root of the fraction 32 times 18 over 50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>32</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.645</mn><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>32</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>18</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></math>

<math alttext="32 plus or minus 1.96 times, the square root of the fraction 32 times 18 over 50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>32</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.96</mn><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>32</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>18</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></math>

<math alttext="0.64 plus or minus 1.282 times, the square root of the fraction 0.64 times 0.36 over 50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>0.64</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.282</mn><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.64</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.36</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></math>

<math alttext="0.64 plus or minus 1.645 times, the square root of the fraction 0.64 times 0.36 over 50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>0.64</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.645</mn><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.64</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.36</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></math>

<math alttext="0.64 plus or minus 1.96 times, the square root of the fraction 0.64 times 0.36 over 50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>0.64</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.96</mn><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.64</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.36</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="0.64 plus or minus 1.645 times, the square root of the fraction 0.64 times 0.36 over 50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>0.64</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.645</mn><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.64</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.36</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></math>

topic.text: 6.2: Constructing a Confidence Interval for a Population Proportion

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Construct a confidence interval, provided conditions for inference are met.
